decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Before commencement of works, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the LPA, to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding: - NR35 Leq,5mins, for plant which will operate during the period of 2300 - 0700 hrs       weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. - NR40 Leq,1hr for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together.   REASON: In the interest of neighbouring amenity, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policy 7.7. | Before the development is commenced, the ventilation duct from the commercial premises, shall be fixed to the wall of the dwelling with suitable anit-vibration isolators and the fan motor shall be vibration isolated from the duct, so as to satisfy an acoustic standard of not exceeding NR25 (Leq5mins) inside a habitable room.  REASON: In the interest of neighbouring amenity, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policy 7.7. | Details shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the dwelling above to demonstrate that an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 (Leq 5mins), 2300-0700 will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 (Leq, 1hour), 00700-2300hrs inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use. Such details as are approved shall be implemented on the first bringing into use of the restaurant.  REASON: In the interest of neighbouring amenity, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policy 7.7. | Details shall be submitted for approval before the development is commenced, for the installation and operation of the best practicable odour abatement equipment. Such details as are approved shall be implemented on the first bringing into use of the restaurant.    REASON: In the interest of neighbouring amenity, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policy 7.7. | Extract ducting from cooking facilities shall discharge at a point not less than 1metre above the eaves of the main building.  REASON: In the interest of neighbouring amenity, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policy 7.7. | The use permitted shall not operate outside 10:00 to 22:00 hours Monday to Sunday.  REASON:   In the interest of neighbouring amenity, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policy 7.7. | Notwithstanding the terms of this approval, further details of the shop front shall be provided to indicate access for disabled persons, and to show the external materials to be used.  REASON:   In the interest of accessibility for all, and the visual amenity of the street scene, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, B6, S30, ES3, B12, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.10, 4.3 and Supplementary Guidance SG1. | The premises shall be used as a restaurant and for no other purpose including a public house, wine bar within Class A3 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:	To accord with the terms of the submitted application and in the interests of the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 7.6.
description: Change of use from car showroom to A3 Restaurant plus new shopfront and extract ducting to rear
